title: rustc confused about cross-crate equivalent types between Oct 12 and Oct 20 nightly
body:
Unfortunately the code to reproduce this is Windows-specific, but I suspect that it might be possible to construct a simplified testcase.  Reqs:

My webrender tree at this commit -- https://github.com/vvuk/webrender/commit/918bc54ab0619a4edccb012a3ed9610bd50c1869
My wrench tree at this commit -- https://github.com/vvuk/wrench/commit/8dcbf408ca28fbf01092773b1ab5dd28b6b58bcb

For simplicity, `webrender` should be checked out in the same parent as `wrench` (there are replacements in Cargo.toml that use relative paths).

webrender/dwrite_helper/src/lib.rs has:
`pub type DWriteFontFace = intptr_t;`

webrender/webrender_traits/src/types.rs has:
`use dwrite_helper::DWriteFontFace;`
`pub type NativeFontHandle = DWriteFontFace;`

wrench/src/main.rs then calls a `dwrite_helper` function that returns a `DWriteFontFace`, and passes it to a `webrender_traits` function that takes a `NativeFontHandle`.  This worked fine in rustc nightly on Oct 12.  With Oct 20, I get:

```
error[E0308]: mismatched types
   --> src\main.rs:161:34
    |
161 |         self.api.add_native_font(face)
    |                                  ^^^^ expected struct `webrender_traits::NativeFontHandle`, found isize
    |
    = note: expected type `webrender_traits::NativeFontHandle`
    = note:    found type `isize`

error: aborting due to previous error

error: Could not compile `wrench`.
```

I tried converting DWriteFontFace to be a tuple, just to see if the error result would change; same issue, just an explicit type name now since it's a distinct type:

```
    = note: expected type `webrender_traits::NativeFontHandle`
    = note:    found type `dwrite_helper::DWriteFontFace`
```
